column10: {'title': 'Laws on anvil to mend Kathmandu-state ties'
column14: 'summary': 'The federal government is preparing to enact necessary laws through ordinance soon in order to facilitate the works of provincial governments and to avert possible “confrontation” with them.The seven provinces are in dire need of laws such as the Police Act
column16: and Civil Servants Adjustment Act for smooth operation of their administration.“The prime minister has directed the ministries to ensure all the laws necessary for provincial governments at the earliest
column18: spokesperson for the Prime Minister’s Office.Due to the urgency of the matter
column19: the Home Ministry sent the Federal Police Act draft to the Law Ministry more than a month ago for approval while the Public Service Commission Act and the Provincial Public Service Commission Act are ready to be presented to the Cabinet.It is necessary for the federal law to come before the corresponding provincial law for the sake of consistency in their provisions. column21: {'title': 'Nepal poised to harvest largest ever paddy crop'
column25: 'summary': 'Nepali farmers look set to harvest the largest paddy crop in history this fiscal year because of timely and sufficient monsoon rains
column26: the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock Development said. Ministry officials added that a record harvest would bring down the country’s rice import bill besides significantly contributing to the government’s economic growth target as the economy is strongly dependent on farm production. column29: 'title': 'Diplomatic deficit as key foreign missions remain headless'
column33: 'summary': 'Delaying the appointment of ambassadors is not a good sign in diplomacy but Nepal’s key mission in New Delhi has been leaderless for a year.full story »'}
column39: 'summary': 'At least 18 cows were killed and another 12 suffered burn injuries when a fire broke out at a shed in Sikles of Kaski district.full story »'}]
